32.text: Pastor Charles Jennings>> Thank you once again for

34.text: allowing us to be a part of your day and to come into

37.text: your home or your place or business or where ever you

41.text: may be and share the Word of the Lord with you. And we

46.text: appreciate you listening, and we appreciate everyone's

49.text: support that they have given and may the Lord bless you

55.text: richly and I want to offer my word of appreciation for

61.text: everyone that has been a part of this ministry. And I

65.text: pray that you've been blessed by this ministry. Today we

70.text: are talking about leadership of a nation and I have

80.text: entitled this program, President Trump Remember What You

86.text: Said? In his inauguration, he said, so help me God. And

97.text: I hope that he knows what that means. And he may never

107.text: hear this program, but if I knew that he would listen at

115.text: some point, I would say, President Trump, do you

122.text: remember when you held your hand up, your right hand up

126.text: before the American people and before God Himself and

132.text: said, I will defend this Constitution from enemies

139.text: within and without, and so forth? And then you said, so

145.text: help me God. And we are required to pray for you. If I

155.text: may make this program a message directly from me to

162.text: President Trump, I say, the Apostle Paul told Timothy

168.text: that we are to pray for you, and in I Timothy chapter 2

174.text: and verse 1, this is what Paul wrote. I exhort

179.text: therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers,

182.text: intercessions, giving of thanks, be made for all men;

185.text: For kings, now you're not our king, but you're our

190.text: President. You are the man that it-, at the pinnacle of

197.text: power in this nation, for kings, and for all that are in

203.text: authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life

207.text: in all godliness and honesty. For this is good and

212.text: acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour. Now in your,

219.text: one of your campaign speeches I heard you say, I am a

226.text: Christian, and you held up a Bible. You said, I brought

231.text: my Bible with me. Do you know that there are

236.text: requirements laid down in the Law of Moses for kings and

246.text: leadership in the land? Turning to Deuteronomy chapter

251.text: number 10, verses 12 and 13, I begin here. Deuteronomy

260.text: 10:12 and 13, And now, Israel, what doth the LORD thy

267.text: God require of thee? Number 1, but to fear the LORD thy

273.text: God, Number 2, to walk in all his ways, Number 3, to

281.text: love him, Number 4, to serve the LORD thy God with all

286.text: thy heart and with all thy soul, and Number 5, To keep

291.text: the commandments of the LORD, and his statutes, which I

295.text: command thee this day for thy good. Also in this Book in

303.text: the 28th chapter, the Lord lays down blessings and

308.text: cursings according to our obedience or our disobedience.

312.text: And He laid down and listed those curses and blessings

318.text: for a reason. And that's not only for personal curses

325.text: and blessings, that's for national curses and blessings.

330.text: It's a long chapter and we don't have time to go there,

332.text: but when we go to Deuteronomy 17, this is extremely

342.text: important, when we go to Deut-, Deuteronomy 17 beginning

349.text: with verse number 14, and these are laws that God has

358.text: laid down for leadership. When thou art come into the

363.text: land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, and shalt

366.text: possess it, and shalt dwell therein, and shalt say, I

370.text: will set a king over me, like as all the other nations

374.text: round about me; Thou shalt in any wise set him a king

381.text: over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: one from

387.text: among thy brethren shalt thou set over thee. You're one

393.text: of our brethren, thou mayest not set a stranger over

398.text: thee, which is not thy brother. But he shall not

403.text: multiply, now this is a requirement, for the kings of

407.text: Israel of the, of the past, but it's also of the

412.text: present. But he shall not multiply horses to himself,

417.text: nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that

423.text: he should multiply horses: forasmuch as the LORD hath

427.text: said unto you, Ye shall henceforth return no more that

431.text: way. Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, he

437.text: shall not be an immoral man, he shall not take advantage

443.text: of the people or the treasury and amass unto himself a

448.text: lot of horses or riches. And Mr. Trump, I realize you

454.text: don't need any more money. You said that. You're a rich

457.text: man. And I don't begrudge that. And don't let riches or

466.text: the influence of power sidetrack you from the mission

471.text: that you have outlined for yourself, for America. So he

478.text: says, Moses said, neither shall he greatly multiply to

482.text: himself silver and gold. But this is what he said, this

492.text: the king to do this. And it shall be, when he sitteth

496.text: upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him

500.text: a copy of this law in a book out of that which is before

504.text: the priests the Levites. The king of Israel saw David,

511.text: all the others, Solomon, they were required to hand

515.text: write a copy of the Law of God for they would know it,

520.text: and that they would follow it. Now I'm not asking you,

561.text: as a Christian man because you declared yourself a

565.text: Christian man, will you read this Book? Will you follow

570.text: this Book? We are in trouble as a nation and we need a

576.text: Godly man as President and a Godly man as

589.text: Pence, I heard him say, I am a Christian. I am a

596.text: conservative and I am a Republican in that order, sounds

603.text: good, sounds real good. And verse number 19 of

612.text: Deuteronomy 17, And it shall be with him, and he shall

617.text: read therein all the days of his life, read the Law of

623.text: God: that he may learn to fear the LORD his God, to keep

629.text: all the words of this law and these statutes, to do

632.text: them: That his heart be not lifted up above his

637.text: brethren. We don't need a tyrant. We don't need a

659.text: going to be like those of the past that were

662.text: self-serving and that were selfish and that sought for

698.text: end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he, and

703.text: his children, in the midst of Israel. And this is an

786.text: by God. I'm glad you said that. But I was hoping that

793.text: you would say, Jesus Christ is our God. Jesus Christ is

801.text: our God. To distinguish us as a Christian nation, as

808.text: opposed to all the other religions of the world,

812.text: Judaism, Islam, who do not accept Jesus Christ as the

822.text: only true God and Saviour, Shinto or Buddha, or, or

841.text: as a people. And in the National Prayer Service, held in

850.text: the national cathedral, following, during that weekend

856.text: following the inauguration, I realize that there were

864.text: Christian. There was a, a, a Jewish rabbi, and a,

871.text: somebody there in some native clothing that I'm not

876.text: quite sure who they were, but they weren't praying in

878.text: the name of Jesus. But I would like to make an

883.text: impression upon you. You may never hear this. I hope you

888.text: do, but I'm speaking out of my heart. I'm not one of the

898.text: out in the wilderness, so to speak. I'm not one of the

904.text: major ministries that has amassed unto themselves houses

909.text: and lands and motorcycles and planes. I have none of

912.text: that. But I speak as a person that loves our country,

917.text: and also loves the principles of God's Word in order to

923.text: govern a Christian country. And we must have total

933.text: dependence upon our God. In Psalm 121 we read these

942.text: words, Psalm 121. The Psalmist starts out by saying

952.text: this, in the King James Bible, It says, I will lift up

962.text: mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

965.text: But that should be, Will I lift up mine eyes unto the

971.text: hills, from whence cometh my help? Our help doesn't come

975.text: from the hills. Hills are representative of nations. He

981.text: says this in 121, verse 2, My help cometh from the LORD,

986.text: which made heaven and earth. So we should read it this

991.text: way, Will I lift up mine eyes unto the nations, from

996.text: whence cometh my help? The answer is no. My help cometh

1000.text: from the Lord which made heaven and made earth. Also in

1006.text: the book of Isaiah, chapter number 33 and verse number

1013.text: 22, 33:22, that silver tongued prophet Isaiah made this

1021.text: statement, For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our

1026.text: lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us. So we

1040.text: our Congress, and king, which is the branch in which you

1055.text: as, at the pinnacle of power in our nation. You are the

1066.text: king, so to speak, in Biblical language, but it says,

1071.text: the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver and the

1079.text: Lord is our king. He will save us. Seek the face of God,

1086.text: Mr. Trump. The, the Bible tells us plain-, plainly in

1098.text: the book of Daniel, I don't want to miss sharing this.

1118.text: number 28, first of all, I want to read these verses.

1123.text: And it came to pass upon king Nebuchadnezzar, At the end

1132.text: of twelve months he walked in the palace of the kingdom

1136.text: of Babylon. The king spake, and said, Is not this great

1157.text: haven't I built this for myself? I have achieved this on

1166.text: my own. This is my accomplishment. Mr. Trump, I want to

1172.text: tell you. Your Presidency, sitting in that branch of

1185.text: accomplishment. I want to say, it is the accomplishment

1212.text: and God was going to debase him, and humble him. And let
